trans-unit.source: Put Job
trans-unit.target: Put Job

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Put Job</languageKeyword> operation creates a new job in the Windows Azure Import/Export service.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Put Job</languageKeyword> operation creates a new job in the Windows Azure Import/Export service.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Put Job</languageKeyword> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Put Job</languageKeyword> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;storage-account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your import job or export job:
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;storage-account-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;job-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your import job or export job:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If specified, it must be <codeInline>application/json</codeInline> (which specifies the JSON Light format).

trans-unit.target: The following is an example header:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Currently only the values <codeInline>en</codeInline> and <codeInline>en-us</codeInline> are supported.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Currently only the values <codeInline>en</codeInline> and <codeInline>en-us</codeInline> are supported.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If this header is specified, the value must be set to <codeInline>identity</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If this header is specified, the value must be set to <codeInline>identity</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Specifies the length of the request body.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Specifies the length of the request body.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If this header is specified, the value must be set to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If this header is specified, the value must be set to <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: All other values will result in status code 406 (<languageKeyword>Not Acceptable</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: All other values will result in status code 406 (<languageKeyword>Not Acceptable</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If specified, the value should specify the date and time when the request is sent, in the RFC 1123 format.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If specified, the value should specify the date and time when the request is sent, in the RFC 1123 format.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Specifies the service management version to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Specifies the service management version to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header must be set to <codeInline>2014-05-01</codeInline> or <codeInline>2014-05-01</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header must be set to <codeInline>2014-05-01</codeInline> or <codeInline>2014-05-01</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A DateTime value.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A DateTime value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has been modified since the specified time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has been modified since the specified time.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A DateTime value.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A DateTime value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has not been modified since the specified date/time.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource has not been modified since the specified date/time.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> An ETag value.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> An ETag value.

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag matches the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag matches the value specified.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> An ETag value, or the wildcard character (*).
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> An ETag value, or the wildcard character (*).

trans-unit.source: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag does not match the value specified.
trans-unit.target: Specify this header to perform the operation only if the resource's ETag does not match the value specified.

trans-unit.source: Specify the wildcard character (*) to perform the operation only if the resource does not exist, and fail the operation if it does exist.
trans-unit.target: Specify the wildcard character (*) to perform the operation only if the resource does not exist, and fail the operation if it does exist.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If this header is specified, its value must be <languageKeyword>PUT</languageKeyword> and the HTTP verb for the request must be <languageKeyword>GET</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> If this header is specified, its value must be <languageKeyword>PUT</languageKeyword> and the HTTP verb for the request must be <languageKeyword>GET</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The request will be processed as if it were a PUT request.
trans-unit.target: The request will be processed as if it were a PUT request.

trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows.

trans-unit.target: The format of the blob list blob is as follows.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Element
trans-unit.target: Element

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The name of the import or export job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The name of the import or export job.

trans-unit.source: Uniquely identifies the job within the same subscription.
trans-unit.target: Uniquely identifies the job within the same subscription.

trans-unit.source: property
trans-unit.target: property

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> A list of properties for the job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> A list of properties for the job.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The storage account key.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The storage account key.

trans-unit.source: You must include either <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> in the request.
trans-unit.target: You must include either <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> in the request.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> is available with all REST versions, while <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is only available with REST version 2014-11-01.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> is available with all REST versions, while <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is only available with REST version 2014-11-01.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The container SAS to use to import or export data to or from the storage account.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The container SAS to use to import or export data to or from the storage account.

trans-unit.source: You must include either <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> in the request.
trans-unit.target: You must include either <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> in the request.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> is available with all REST versions, while <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is only available with REST version 2014-11-01.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> is available with all REST versions, while <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is only available with REST version 2014-11-01.

trans-unit.source: The value of <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> must start with the container name, followed by a question mark (?) and the SAS token.
trans-unit.target: The value of <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> must start with the container name, followed by a question mark (?) and the SAS token.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The permissions, whether specified on the URL or in a stored access policy, must include Read, Write, and Delete for import jobs, and Read, Write and List for export jobs.
trans-unit.target: The permissions, whether specified on the URL or in a stored access policy, must include Read, Write, and Delete for import jobs, and Read, Write and List for export jobs.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> (service version) parameter must be set to version 2014-02-14 or later.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>sv</parameterReference> (service version) parameter must be set to version 2014-02-14 or later.

trans-unit.source: When <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is specified, all blobs to be imported or exported must be within the container specified in the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: When <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is specified, all blobs to be imported or exported must be within the container specified in the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> must also include this container.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> must also include this container.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The location where the job will be processed.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The location where the job will be processed.

trans-unit.source: Note this may not be the same location where your storage account resides.
trans-unit.target: Note this may not be the same location where your storage account resides.

trans-unit.source: See the <link xlink:href="6260cd93-6c8e-4986-a2b6-a3c9df886ff6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link> operation to obtain the correct location.
trans-unit.target: See the <link xlink:href="6260cd93-6c8e-4986-a2b6-a3c9df886ff6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link> operation to obtain the correct location.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Indicates whether this is an import job or an export job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Indicates whether this is an import job or an export job.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A human-readable name for the job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A human-readable name for the job.

trans-unit.source: May contain Unicode characters and spaces.
trans-unit.target: May contain Unicode characters and spaces.

trans-unit.source: CDATA
trans-unit.target: CDATA

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A human-readable description of the job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A human-readable description of the job.

trans-unit.source: CDATA
trans-unit.target: CDATA

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Metadata associated with the job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Metadata associated with the job.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The container or virtual directory where the copy logs and backups of drive manifest files (if enabled) will be stored.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The container or virtual directory where the copy logs and backups of drive manifest files (if enabled) will be stored.

trans-unit.source: If a value is not specified for this element, the logs and manifest files will be written to a container or virtual directory named waimportexport.
trans-unit.target: If a value is not specified for this element, the logs and manifest files will be written to a container or virtual directory named waimportexport.

trans-unit.source: If a <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> is specified on the request, then logs and manifest files will be written to a container with that name.
trans-unit.target: If a <languageKeyword>StorageAccountKey</languageKeyword> is specified on the request, then logs and manifest files will be written to a container with that name.

trans-unit.source: If a <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is specified, then logs and manifest files will be written to a virtual directory named named <parameterReference>waimportexport</parameterReference> and located beneath the container named in the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: If a <languageKeyword>ContainerSas</languageKeyword> is specified, then logs and manifest files will be written to a virtual directory named named <parameterReference>waimportexport</parameterReference> and located beneath the container named in the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="38cc16bd-ad55-4625-9a85-e1726c35fd1b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Log File Format</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="38cc16bd-ad55-4625-9a85-e1726c35fd1b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Log File Format</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Note that in REST version 2014-05-01, this element is called <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesContainer</languageKeyword> and its value must be a container name.
trans-unit.target: Note that in REST version 2014-05-01, this element is called <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesContainer</languageKeyword> and its value must be a container name.

trans-unit.source: Boolean
trans-unit.target: Boolean

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Default value is false.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Default value is false.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether verbose logging will be enabled.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether verbose logging will be enabled.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, the verbose log will contain detailed logs for each chunk copy, including status for both successful and non-successful copy operations.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, the verbose log will contain detailed logs for each chunk copy, including status for both successful and non-successful copy operations.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of whether verbose logging is enabled, warnings and errors will always be logged.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of whether verbose logging is enabled, warnings and errors will always be logged.

trans-unit.source: Log files are stored as block blobs in the container specified by the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> element, using the following naming convention: <codeInline>waies/jobname_driveid_timestamp_logtype.xml</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Log files are stored as block blobs in the container specified by the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> element, using the following naming convention: <codeInline>waies/jobname_driveid_timestamp_logtype.xml</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The addresses of the verbose logs (if enabled) and error logs are returned by the <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: The addresses of the verbose logs (if enabled) and error logs are returned by the <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Boolean
trans-unit.target: Boolean

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Default value is false.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Default value is false.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the manifest files on the drives should be copied to block blobs.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the manifest files on the drives should be copied to block blobs.

trans-unit.source: If this value is true, the destination blobs will be stored in the container specified by the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: If this value is true, the destination blobs will be stored in the container specified by the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: Manifest files are stored as block blobs in the container specified by the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> element, using the following naming convention:
trans-unit.target: Manifest files are stored as block blobs in the container specified by the <languageKeyword>ImportExportStatesPath</languageKeyword> element, using the following naming convention:

trans-unit.source: The addresses of the manifest file backups are returned by the <languageKeyword>Get Job</languageKeyword> operation.
trans-unit.target: The addresses of the manifest file backups are returned by the <languageKeyword>Get Job</languageKeyword> operation.

trans-unit.source: property
trans-unit.target: property

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Specifies the return address information for the job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> Specifies the return address information for the job.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The name of the recipient who will receive the hard drives when they are returned.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The name of the recipient who will receive the hard drives when they are returned.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Address of the recipient of the returned drives.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Address of the recipient of the returned drives.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Phone number of the recipient of the returned drives.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Phone number of the recipient of the returned drives.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Email address of the recipient of the returned drives.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Email address of the recipient of the returned drives.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the return carrier and customer’s account with the carrier.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the return carrier and customer’s account with the carrier.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The carrier’s name.
trans-unit.target: The carrier’s name.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The customer’s account number with the carrier.
trans-unit.target: The customer’s account number with the carrier.

trans-unit.source: property
trans-unit.target: property

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> List of up to ten drives that comprise the job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> List of up to ten drives that comprise the job.

trans-unit.source: The drive list is a required element for an import job; it is not specified for export jobs.
trans-unit.target: The drive list is a required element for an import job; it is not specified for export jobs.

trans-unit.source: property
trans-unit.target: property

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Contains information about a drive.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> Contains information about a drive.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The drive's hardware serial number, without spaces.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The drive's hardware serial number, without spaces.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The BitLocker key used to encrypt the drive.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The BitLocker key used to encrypt the drive.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The relative path of the manifest file on the drive.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The relative path of the manifest file on the drive.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The Base16-encoded MD5 hash of the manifest file on the drive.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The Base16-encoded MD5 hash of the manifest file on the drive.

trans-unit.source: property
trans-unit.target: property

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A property containing information about the blobs to be exported for an export job.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A property containing information about the blobs to be exported for an export job.

trans-unit.source: This property is required for export jobs, but must not be specified for import jobs.
trans-unit.target: This property is required for export jobs, but must not be specified for import jobs.

trans-unit.source: property
trans-unit.target: property

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A list of the blobs to be exported.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A list of the blobs to be exported.

trans-unit.source: The size of the data provided for this property must not exceed 32KB.
trans-unit.target: The size of the data provided for this property must not exceed 32KB.

trans-unit.source: If it is larger than 32KB, store the information as a blob in the storage account associated with the export job, and specify the <languageKeyword>BlobListBlobPath</languageKeyword> property to point to this blob.
trans-unit.target: If it is larger than 32KB, store the information as a blob in the storage account associated with the export job, and specify the <languageKeyword>BlobListBlobPath</languageKeyword> property to point to this blob.

trans-unit.source: Note that any snapshots of the specified blobs will also be exported.
trans-unit.target: Note that any snapshots of the specified blobs will also be exported.

trans-unit.source: For block blobs, only committed blobs and blocks are exported.
trans-unit.target: For block blobs, only committed blobs and blocks are exported.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="c864893e-d758-475a-b419-af0c60dd2569" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Block List (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs (REST API)</link> for more information about committed and uncommitted blocks.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="c864893e-d758-475a-b419-af0c60dd2569" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Put Block List (REST API)</link> and <link xlink:href="fa4760a6-5343-4aa1-b484-df823ce817e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Blobs (REST API)</link> for more information about committed and uncommitted blocks.

trans-unit.source: Collection
trans-unit.target: Collection

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A collection of <languageKeyword>blob-path</languageKeyword> strings.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A collection of <languageKeyword>blob-path</languageKeyword> strings.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The relative URI to the blob, beginning with the container name.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> The relative URI to the blob, beginning with the container name.

trans-unit.source: If the blob is in root container, you must explicitly specify <codeInline>$root</codeInline> in the path.
trans-unit.target: If the blob is in root container, you must explicitly specify <codeInline>$root</codeInline> in the path.

trans-unit.source: Collection
trans-unit.target: Collection

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A collection of <languageKeyword>blob-prefix</languageKeyword> strings.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> A collection of <languageKeyword>blob-prefix</languageKeyword> strings.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> A blob path prefix that specifies all blobs whose relative path begins with that prefix.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required.</embeddedLabel> A blob path prefix that specifies all blobs whose relative path begins with that prefix.

trans-unit.source: The prefix must begin with a forward slash "/" and must include the container name.
trans-unit.target: The prefix must begin with a forward slash "/" and must include the container name.

trans-unit.source: If the container is the root container, you must explicitly specify <codeInline>$root</codeInline> in the path.
trans-unit.target: If the container is the root container, you must explicitly specify <codeInline>$root</codeInline> in the path.

trans-unit.source: See the <embeddedLabel>Remarks</embeddedLabel> section for examples of valid blob prefix values.
trans-unit.target: See the <embeddedLabel>Remarks</embeddedLabel> section for examples of valid blob prefix values.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The relative URI to the block blob that contains the list of blob paths or blob path prefixes as defined above, beginning with the container name.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Optional.</embeddedLabel> The relative URI to the block blob that contains the list of blob paths or blob path prefixes as defined above, beginning with the container name.

trans-unit.source: If the blob is in root container, the URI must begin with <codeInline>$root</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If the blob is in root container, the URI must begin with <codeInline>$root</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The following describes the general format for listing blobs in the <languageKeyword>BlobList</languageKeyword> blob:
trans-unit.target: The following describes the general format for listing blobs in the <languageKeyword>BlobList</languageKeyword> blob:

trans-unit.source: The elements and attributes of the XML format are defined as follows.
trans-unit.target: The elements and attributes of the XML format are defined as follows.

trans-unit.source: XML Element
trans-unit.target: XML Element

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: BlobList
trans-unit.target: BlobList

trans-unit.source: Root element
trans-unit.target: Root element

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of blob paths or prefixes for the blobs to be exported.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of blob paths or prefixes for the blobs to be exported.

trans-unit.source: BlobList/BlobPathPrefix
trans-unit.target: BlobList/BlobPathPrefix

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A blob path prefix that specifies all blobs whose relative path begins with that prefix.
trans-unit.target: A blob path prefix that specifies all blobs whose relative path begins with that prefix.

trans-unit.source: The prefix must begin with a forward slash "/" and must include the container name.
trans-unit.target: The prefix must begin with a forward slash "/" and must include the container name.

trans-unit.source: If the container is the root container, you must explicitly specify $root in the path.
trans-unit.target: If the container is the root container, you must explicitly specify $root in the path.

trans-unit.source: BlobList/BlobPath
trans-unit.target: BlobList/BlobPath

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The relative URI to the blob, beginning with the container name.
trans-unit.target: The relative URI to the blob, beginning with the container name.

trans-unit.source: If the blob is in root container, you must explicitly specify $root in the path.
trans-unit.target: If the blob is in root container, you must explicitly specify $root in the path.

trans-unit.source: BlobList/BlobPath/@IncludeSnapshots
trans-unit.target: BlobList/BlobPath/@IncludeSnapshots

trans-unit.source: Attribute, Boolean
trans-unit.target: Attribute, Boolean

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to include all snapshots of the blob.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to include all snapshots of the blob.

trans-unit.source: The default value is true.
trans-unit.target: The default value is true.

trans-unit.source: BlobList/BlobPath/@SnapshotTime
trans-unit.target: BlobList/BlobPath/@SnapshotTime

trans-unit.source: Attribute, DateTime
trans-unit.target: Attribute, DateTime

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the snapshot identifier for a blob snapshot.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the snapshot identifier for a blob snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The value of this header will always be <codeInline>identity</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header will always be <codeInline>identity</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The length of the content returned in the response.
trans-unit.target: The length of the content returned in the response.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the format in which the results are returned.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the format in which the results are returned.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header will always be <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header will always be <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The address of the job being created.
trans-unit.target: The address of the job being created.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Contains a value that the client can use to perform conditional operations by using the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> request header.
trans-unit.target: Contains a value that the client can use to perform conditional operations by using the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> request header.

trans-unit.source: The date/time that the job was last modified.
trans-unit.target: The date/time that the job was last modified.

trans-unit.source: The date format follows RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date format follows RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers.

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the Import/Export service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the Import/Export service.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Import/Export service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Import/Export service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: If the request fails, the response body will contain the following error message:
trans-unit.target: If the request fails, the response body will contain the following error message:

trans-unit.source: Element
trans-unit.target: Element

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: The standard HTTP status code returned when the request fails.
trans-unit.target: The standard HTTP status code returned when the request fails.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: A human-readable description of the error.
trans-unit.target: A human-readable description of the error.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: A predefined error code, if applicable.
trans-unit.target: A predefined error code, if applicable.

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Additional information provided to diagnose the error.
trans-unit.target: Additional information provided to diagnose the error.

trans-unit.source: Sample Request and Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Request and Response

trans-unit.source: The following shows a sample request and response for the <languageKeyword>Put Job </languageKeyword>operation.
trans-unit.target: The following shows a sample request and response for the <languageKeyword>Put Job </languageKeyword>operation.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: A subscription may have up to twenty jobs active at any given time, not counting jobs that are in the <languageKeyword>Completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: A subscription may have up to twenty jobs active at any given time, not counting jobs that are in the <languageKeyword>Completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: Each job may be in one of several different job states; in each state, operations are expected to complete within a certain period of time, or the job will be internally marked as faulted and an investigation will be conducted.
trans-unit.target: Each job may be in one of several different job states; in each state, operations are expected to complete within a certain period of time, or the job will be internally marked as faulted and an investigation will be conducted.

trans-unit.source: Each job may be comprised of up to ten drives for import or export.
trans-unit.target: Each job may be comprised of up to ten drives for import or export.

trans-unit.source: To import data that spans more than ten drives, you'll need to create additional jobs.
trans-unit.target: To import data that spans more than ten drives, you'll need to create additional jobs.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you specify a job name that is already associated with a job in the same subscription that is in any state other than <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>, the new <languageKeyword>Put Job</languageKeyword> request will be rejected, regardless of any conditional headers specified.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you specify a job name that is already associated with a job in the same subscription that is in any state other than <languageKeyword>Creating</languageKeyword>, the new <languageKeyword>Put Job</languageKeyword> request will be rejected, regardless of any conditional headers specified.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to reuse the same job name, you must first complete the existing job and then delete it.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to reuse the same job name, you must first complete the existing job and then delete it.

trans-unit.source: To update properties of an existing job, you can call the <link xlink:href="6f83d480-c09e-4e3b-b096-46e140e8c93d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Job Properties</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: To update properties of an existing job, you can call the <link xlink:href="6f83d480-c09e-4e3b-b096-46e140e8c93d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Update Job Properties</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: After you create a job, you must ship your disks within two weeks.
trans-unit.target: After you create a job, you must ship your disks within two weeks.

trans-unit.source: If the disks are not shipped within that interval, the job will automatically be deleted by the Windows Azure Import/Export service.
trans-unit.target: If the disks are not shipped within that interval, the job will automatically be deleted by the Windows Azure Import/Export service.

trans-unit.source: The service will automatically delete a completed job after 90 days.
trans-unit.target: The service will automatically delete a completed job after 90 days.

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly delete the job prior to that time by calling the <link xlink:href="fb95c79c-05a1-46f8-a3f9-f5451c6f473f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Job</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: You can explicitly delete the job prior to that time by calling the <link xlink:href="fb95c79c-05a1-46f8-a3f9-f5451c6f473f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete Job</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: When you create an export job, you can specify the blobs to be exported in any of these ways:
trans-unit.target: When you create an export job, you can specify the blobs to be exported in any of these ways:

trans-unit.source: You can specify a full blob path to export a single blob.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a full blob path to export a single blob.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a blob path prefix to export all blobs that begin with the prefix.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a blob path prefix to export all blobs that begin with the prefix.

trans-unit.source: The prefix must begin with a forward slash and all or part of the container name.
trans-unit.target: The prefix must begin with a forward slash and all or part of the container name.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a relative URI to a blob in the storage account that contains a list of blobs to export.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a relative URI to a blob in the storage account that contains a list of blobs to export.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows some examples of valid blob paths and prefixes:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows some examples of valid blob paths and prefixes:

trans-unit.source: Prefix
trans-unit.target: Prefix

trans-unit.source: Matches These Blobs
trans-unit.target: Matches These Blobs

trans-unit.source: All blobs in container <codeInline>picturecontainer</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: All blobs in container <codeInline>picturecontainer</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: All blobs in containers <codeInline>bob</codeInline> and <codeInline>bobkids</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: All blobs in containers <codeInline>bob</codeInline> and <codeInline>bobkids</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: All blobs in container <codeInline>bob</codeInline>, but not <codeInline>bobkids</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer</codeInline> or <codeInline>videocontainer</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: All blobs in container <codeInline>bob</codeInline>, but not <codeInline>bobkids</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer</codeInline> or <codeInline>videocontainer</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: Blobs <codeInline>picturecontainer/image</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer/image.png</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer/ image2.png</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer/image/photo.png</codeInline>, and <codeInline>picturecontainer/imagefiles/photo.png</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: Blobs <codeInline>picturecontainer/image</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer/image.png</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer/ image2.png</codeInline>, <codeInline>picturecontainer/image/photo.png</codeInline>, and <codeInline>picturecontainer/imagefiles/photo.png</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: All blobs in the root container
trans-unit.target: All blobs in the root container

trans-unit.source: All blobs in all containers, including the root container.
trans-unit.target: All blobs in all containers, including the root container.

trans-unit.source: If a blob to be exported is currently leased, the service attempts to create a snapshot of the blob and export the snapshot instead of the original blob.
trans-unit.target: If a blob to be exported is currently leased, the service attempts to create a snapshot of the blob and export the snapshot instead of the original blob.

trans-unit.source: If a snapshot cannot be created, the blob will be skipped for the current export job but will be included in the incomplete blob list (see <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link>).
trans-unit.target: If a snapshot cannot be created, the blob will be skipped for the current export job but will be included in the incomplete blob list (see <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link>).

trans-unit.source: Conditional Headers
trans-unit.target: Conditional Headers

trans-unit.source: You can call <languageKeyword>Put Job </languageKeyword>with conditional headers specified to create the job only when certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.target: You can call <languageKeyword>Put Job </languageKeyword>with conditional headers specified to create the job only when certain conditions are met.

trans-unit.source: When specifying conditional headers, keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: When specifying conditional headers, keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Modified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-None-Match</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If a request specifies both the <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>If-Unmodified-Since</parameterReference> headers, the request is evaluated based on the criteria specified in <parameterReference>If-Match</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: With the exception of the two combinations of conditional headers listed above, a request may specify only a single conditional header.
trans-unit.target: With the exception of the two combinations of conditional headers listed above, a request may specify only a single conditional header.

trans-unit.source: Specifying more than one conditional header results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).
trans-unit.target: Specifying more than one conditional header results in status code 400 (<languageKeyword>Bad Request</languageKeyword>).

trans-unit.source: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header:
trans-unit.target: The following table indicates the response codes returned for an unmet condition for each conditional header:

trans-unit.source: Conditional header
trans-unit.target: Conditional header

trans-unit.source: Response code if condition has not been met
trans-unit.target: Response code if condition has not been met

trans-unit.source: Precondition Failed (412)
trans-unit.target: Precondition Failed (412)

trans-unit.source: Precondition Failed (412)
trans-unit.target: Precondition Failed (412)

trans-unit.source: Precondition Failed (412)
trans-unit.target: Precondition Failed (412)

trans-unit.source: Precondition Failed (412)
trans-unit.target: Precondition Failed (412)
